revised_title: The Absorption of Röntgen's Rays by Aqueous Solutions of Metallic Salts: A Study of the Effect of Atomic Weight and Acid Radicle
tldr: The authors investigate the absorption of X-rays by aqueous solutions of metallic salts and find that the absorbing power depends on the atomic weight and not the density or combining proportions of the substances. They also discover that the total absorption produced by a solution is the sum of the absorptions of the salt and its solvent.
